docs.snippet: The tenth game of the world chess championship between Mikhail Tal of Latvia and Mikhail Botvinnik, the titleholder, ended in a draw after sixty moves, according to a report from Moscow last night. The defender trails, 5 1/2 -- 4 1/2.
docs.lead_paragraph: The tenth game of the world chess championship between Mikhail Tal of Latvia and Mikhail Botvinnik, the titleholder, ended in a draw after sixty moves, according to a report from Moscow last night. The defender trails, 5 1/2 -- 4 1/2.

headline.main: BOTVINNIK DRAWS WITH TAL IN CHESS; Champion Trails by 5 1/2-4 1/2 After 60 Moves -- Fischer Wins at Mar del Plata

docs.snippet: BEAUMONT, Tex., April 8 (AP) -- Betsy Rawls carded a seven-under-par 67 and took a two-stroke lead in the first round of the $6,500 Babe Zaharias open golf tournament today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEAUMONT, Tex., April 8 (AP) -- Betsy Rawls carded a seven-under-par 67 and took a two-stroke lead in the first round of the $6,500 Babe Zaharias open golf tournament today.

headline.main: MISS RAWLS GAINS TWO-STROKE LEAD; South Carolina Player Gets 67 in Babe Zaharias Open -- Miss Suggs Second

docs.snippet: Mikhail Tal of Latvia, challenging for the world chess championship in his match With Mikhail Botvinnik at Moscow, widened his lead yesterday when he converted a slight edge in the ending to another victory in seventy-two moves.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mikhail Tal of Latvia, challenging for the world chess championship in his match With Mikhail Botvinnik at Moscow, widened his lead yesterday when he converted a slight edge in the ending to another victory in seventy-two moves.

headline.main: Tal Beats Botvinnik In 72 Chess Moves For 6 1/2-4 1/2 lead
BIGGEST TANKER AT SEA; National Defender Is Taking Huge Cargo to Uruguay

docs.snippet: The United States chess champion, Bobby Fischer, won again in the ninth round of the international chess tournament at Mar del Plata, Argentina, yesterday, according to a report reaching here last night through South American news sources.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States chess champion, Bobby Fischer, won again in the ninth round of the international chess tournament at Mar del Plata, Argentina, yesterday, according to a report reaching here last night through South American news sources.

headline.main: FISCHER DEFEATS BIELICKI IN CHESS; Wins in 38 Moves to Retain 2d Place in Argentina -- Spassky Scores

docs.snippet: A seventeen-year-old exchange student from Brazil said yesterday there was resentment in her country over the attitude of American business men there.
docs.lead_paragraph: A seventeen-year-old exchange student from Brazil said yesterday there was resentment in her country over the attitude of American business men there.
docs.abstract: Inter-Amer Development Bank pres Herrera and NY Times Youth Forum discuss relations with US; Brazilian girl scores US business men for lack of interest in Latin Amer while doing business there

headline.main: LATIN GIRL SCORES U.S. BUSINESS MEN; Brazilian Student on Youth Panel Says They Ignore South American Culture

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: BEAUMONT, Tex., April 10 (AP) -- Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg S.C., shook off a determined threat by Fay Cracker on the last nine holes today to shoot a par 73 and repeat her last year's victory in the $6,500 Babe Zaharias golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEAUMONT, Tex., April 10 (AP) -- Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg S.C., shook off a determined threat by Fay Cracker on the last nine holes today to shoot a par 73 and repeat her last year's victory in the $6,500 Babe Zaharias golf tournament.

headline.main: MISS RAILS TOPS FIELD WITH A 211; Shoots Final 73 in Zaharias Golf -- Fay Crocker Has 70-213 for Second

docs.snippet: Week Ended April 8, 1960 The strong upward movement of the British pound sterling continued in foreign exchange trading during the past week. Canadian dollar showed signs of weakness as it drifted lower on active and at times heavy dealings.
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended April 8, 1960 The strong upward movement of the British pound sterling continued in foreign exchange trading during the past week. Canadian dollar showed signs of weakness as it drifted lower on active and at times heavy dealings.

docs.snippet: The keen race between Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union and Bobby Fischer, the United States champion, continued yesterday in the international chess tournament at Mar del Plata, Argentina. Both were winners in the tenth round, according to a report...
docs.lead_paragraph: The keen race between Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union and Bobby Fischer, the United States champion, continued yesterday in the international chess tournament at Mar del Plata, Argentina. Both were winners in the tenth round, according to a report received through South American news sources.

docs.snippet: Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union and Bobby Fischer, the United States champion, posted victories again in the eleventh round of the chess tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentine news sources.
docs.lead_paragraph: Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union and Bobby Fischer, the United States champion, posted victories again in the eleventh round of the chess tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentine news sources.

headline.main: LEADERS ADVANCE AT MAR DEL PLATA; Spassky Beats Letelier in 49 Moves -- Fischer Downs incutto in Ruy Lopez
